newsitem.title: CANADA: Vancouver Airport reports March cargo gains.
newsitem.headline: Vancouver Airport reports March cargo gains.

text.p: March cargo traffic at Vancouver International Airport was 7.3 percent higher than a year ago, paced by a 16.2 percent rise in the traffic carried by integrated carriers, the airport authority said.
Total tonnage carried in March was 21,465 tonnes, up from 20,007 in March 1996.
Cargo traffic on scheduled carriers, domestic and international, rose 5.6 percent to 17,823 tonnes.
The integrated carriers are a small factor in comparison, with only 3,642 tonnes carried at Vancouver, but their growth rate is consistently higher than scheduled carriers.
Through the first quarter of 1997, integrator traffic is up 32 percent versus a 2.9 percent gain for freight carried on the scheduled carriers.
